content.description: The distribution of prices for a certain car model is approximately normal with mean $21,800 and standard deviation $400. A random sample of 4 cars of the model will be selected.
content.question: What is the correct unit of measure for the mean of the sampling distribution of <math alttext="x bar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>Â¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: There are no units associated with the mean of the sampling distribution.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
